reg_info.full_title: R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 561: EXEMPTION - SUBSECTION 38 (2) OF THE ACT
reg_info.citation: R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 561: EXEMPTION - SUBSECTION 38 (2) OF THE ACT
reg_info.act_under: Health Protection and Promotion Act   Loi sur la protection et la promotion de la santé

content.content: 1. Until April 3, 1995, a physician or other person authorized to administer an immunizing agent is exempt from the requirements of subsection 38 (2) of the Act if the patient to whom the immunizing agent is to be administered is not competent to consent and there is no committee of the person appointed under the Mental Incompetency Act to consent on the patient’s behalf. O. Reg. 23/95, s. 1.
content.raw_html: 1. Until April 3, 1995, a physician or other person authorized to administer an immunizing agent is exempt from the requirements of subsection 38 (2) of the Act if the patient to whom the immunizing agent is to be administered is not competent to consent and there is no committee of the person appointed under the Mental Incompetency Act to consent on the patient’s behalf. O. Reg. 23/95, s. 1.
